meanings.sent1: That dingus forgot his keys again.
meanings.sent2: Don't be a dingus and double-check your work.
meanings.sent3: The dingus thought the moon was made of cheese.
meanings.sent4: He's such a dingus, he tried to swim in a puddle.
meanings.sent5: The classroom dingus always asks silly questions.

meanings.definition: An object or gadget whose name is unknown or forgotten.
meanings.sent1: Can you pass me that dingus over there?
meanings.sent2: I need a dingus to fix this broken chair.
meanings.sent3: I found a mysterious dingus in the attic.
meanings.sent4: The old house was full of strange dinguses.
meanings.sent5: She always keeps a collection of random dinguses.

meanings.sent1: The mechanic used a dingus to tighten the bolt.
meanings.sent2: I always carry a dingus in my pocket for emergencies.
meanings.sent3: Grandpa's toolbox is full of rusty dinguses.
meanings.sent4: She invented a new dingus to help with gardening.
meanings.sent5: The Swiss Army knife is a handy dingus to have.
